suggestions: For MCH: Discuss with your doctor to determine the cause of the elevated MCH.
For MCH: Further tests such as Vitamin B12 and folate levels may be recommended.
For Urea: Ensure adequate hydration throughout the day and avoid excessive protein intake.
For Urea: Consult your physician to investigate potential causes, including kidney function.
For Hematocrit: Discuss with your doctor to identify the underlying cause of low hematocrit.
For Hematocrit: Consider a dietary review for iron-rich foods, Vitamin B12, and folate, as these deficiencies can contribute to anemia.
